name: Tag selector
description:
Element with tag **A** goes just by ```A```
**Example**: ```p``` selects all paragraph (```<p>```) elements

name: Descendant selector
task:
Select the cat
on a dog
description:
You can select descendant (any depth child) of ```A``` with selector ```B``` as ```A B```

**Example**: ```ul li``` selects all elements of unordered list

name: Class selector
description:
Elements with set class **A** can be selected by ```.A```.
**Example**: ```.big``` will select all elements with **big** class

name: ID selector
description:
With selector ```#id``` you can select element **s.t.** it's ID = ```id```.
**Hint**: selectors can be applied simultaniously as ```AB```

name: Attribute selector
description:
If you want to specify attribute values of element, you can do it as ```[attribute="value"]```
**Example**: ```input[type="text"]``` selects all text inputs

name: A little exercise!
task:
Select the corgy
on the couch
description:
It's time for **you** to shine! Show what you've learnt!
**You can do it!**

name: Adjacent sibling
task:
Select the cat
next to a fish
description:
Selector ```A + B``` is meant for elements **B** that directly follow **A**
**Example**: ```span + button``` selects every button that comes after ```<span>```

name: :only-child
description:
You can select elements that are the only ones within their parents with the ```:only-child``` pseudo-selector.
**Example**: ```div:only-child``` selects **div**s that are the only children in their parents

name: :nth-of-type
task:
Select the third dog
on the floor
description:
```A:nth-of-type``` pseudo-class is meant for selecting the nth **A** sibling.
**Example**:```img:nth-of-type(3)``` with select all 3rd sibling images

name: Comma combinator
description:
You can combine multiple selectors for elements to match either one of specified as ```A, B```.
**Example**: ```a, img``` selects both anchors and images

name: Universal selector
task:
Select every pet
in the room!
description:
Universal selector ```*``` can help you select **every** element on the page.
**Hint**: you can combine it with descendant operator to select all descendants. Use your already gained knowledge!
